Key Match Events: The Angels tied the game in the eighth inning with a successful squeeze play
Taylor Ward grounded into a double play with the go-ahead run at third
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington said that José Suarez 'battled, and he kept us in the ballgame, and that's all you can ask for'
Washington also mentioned that the Angels had some offensive opportunities but hit into three critical double plays
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels walked three times and singled in the first inning but didn’t score
Shortstop Zach Neto made two costly miscues on the bases, including being picked off and caught stealing after he singled off the left-field wall
Others: The Angels are one defeat away from setting the dubious record of 121 losses in a season
José Suarez has solid stuff and had success from 2021-22, when he had a 3.86 ERA in a combined 207 1/3 innings
